q: In networking, you are required to integrate a DHCP server with a DNS server so that the DNS server is updated dynamically if the DHCP server changes an IP. Which of the following situations justifies with no such updates if both clients and servers are using windows?

a.option: When ipconfig /renew is used in a client
When ipconfig /registerdns is used in a client
When ipconfig /flushdns is used in a client
It occurs in all of these situations

q: In networking, which of the following components of the CAN communication stack in the AUTOSAR compliant system is responsible for controlling the external CAN transceiver that observes the bus and provides physical network diagnostics?

In networking, a VPN tunnel is created between the virtual data center networks of two organizations. If the tunnel endpoints contain a firewall between them, then which of the following UDP ports must be used?

In networking, if you are required to use the CAN protocol to maintain a qualitative measure of a CAN transceiver in the developed automotive, then which of the following data must be recorded and analyzed:

  1. Propagation delay of a signal in the internal loop from the driver
  2. Propagation delay of a signal in the external loop from the driver
  3. Noise of a signal in the external loop from the driver
  4. Noise of a signal in the internal loop from the driver
  5. Input provided to the receiver output
In networking, if you are dependent on responses to TCP/IP stack fingerprinting techniques, then which of the following tools is used to conduct operating system fingerprint techniques?

In networking, you are provided with a microcontroller to communicate with multiple devices on the bus. The devices are as follows:

  • Four LED blinkers
  • Two LCD driver
  • One data converter
  • One EEPROM

Which of these communication protocols allows you to use the minimum number of wires and minimum power?

In networking, which of the following error detection methods in the CAN data link layers verifies the structure of transmitted data and remote frames by checking the bit fields based on the fixed format and frame size?
In networking, which of the following modules of the CAN stack contains messages with a payload of more than 8 bytes that reassembles at the receiver system?

In networking, you are provided with a network that contains 150 hosts that are connected by a TCP/IP router. The network is allocated to the class C network whose IP address is 192.168.123.0. Which of the following IP addresses are not assigned to the host:

  1. 192.168.1.1
  2. 192.168.123.0
  3. 192.168.123.255
  4. 192.168.1.123

In networking, the close (sockfd) file descriptor is used to restrict the read and write access to the socket. The int shutdown (int sockfd, int how) method is used to block communication in one direction. Which of the following statements will you use to stop transmission from the socket?

In networking, you are required to use the Unified Diagnostic Services protocol to find the cause of a failure. The diagnostic tester sends a request that is sent to all the engine control units on the CAN network. Which of the following requests is sent by the diagnostic tester?
In networking, the CAN data link layer protocol detects single-bit or multi-bit errors. Which of the following steps is performed to provide data consistency in all the nodes?

a.option: Single-bit errors are converted to multi-bit errors
Multi-bit errors are converted to single-bit errors

q:
In networking, which of the following statements about the TCP ZeroWindow probes is correct:

  1. The window probes are transferred until space is free in the input window of the remote host.
  2. A window probe drives the remote host to return a packet with its updated input window size.
In networking, if the IP address that is assigned to a client by the DHCP server is incorrect, then which of the following statements justifies the occurrence of the issue?

a.option: DHCP server is in a different subnet from the client
Multiple DHCP servers exist on the LAN
Client may have used the Automatic Private IP Addressing method
Client may have used the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency branch

q:
In networking, which of the following statements are valid regarding a remote frame that is available in an automotive ECU with the CAN protocol:

  1. A recessive RTR bit in the arbitration field can be set for a remote frame.
  2. No data must be specified in a remote frame.

In networking, which of the following are the components of the CAN communication stack:

  1. COM
  2. PDU Router
  3. CAN State Manager
  4. CAN Network Manager
In networking, which of the following is not identified as errors by the Internet checksum in packets that are received over the User Datagram Protocol?

a.option: Bits indicating the length of the packets are corrupted

q:
In networking, the following method is used to create a socket in C:

int sockid = socket(family, type, protocol);

If the type and family of the socket are SOCK_DGRAM and PF_INET respectively, then which of these statements about the socket connection is correct:

  1. Socket is a reliable and two-way, connection-based service
  2. Socket is unreliable and connectionless
  3. Connection can be using IPv4 protocols or Internet address
In networking, if a CIDR is represented by 20.10.30.35/27, then which of the following is the valid range of addresses?

In networking, you are provided with a wide area network that contains 150 hosts and three networks that contain 50 hosts. Each host is connected by a TCP/IP router. The network is allocated to the class C network whose IP address is 192.168.123.0. If a network administrator uses the subnet mask 255.255.255.192 to make four networks of 62 hosts each, then which of the following addresses is an invalid host address:

  1. 192.168.123.63
  2. 192.168.123.64
  3. 192.168.123.191
  4. 192.168.123.255

In networking, the bit stuffing mechanism is used to detect errors at the bit level in the CAN protocol. Determine the number of consecutive equal bits after which a sender inserts a stuff bit into the bitstream to generate the synchronization edges while performing the synchronization process.

In Networking, you are working on the Control Area Network Interface Bus (CAN). The CanIf design is optimized to manage CAN protocol-specific capabilities and handling of the used underlying CAN Controller. CanIf needs information about all used upper communication service layers and L-SDUs to be dispatched. Now, if you are required to integrate inside the AUTOSAR COM stack, then which of the following actions must be performed at the configuration time in this scenario:

Actions

  1. By transmitting the upper layer module and transmit I-PDU for each transmit L-SDU.
  2. By receiving upper layer module and receive I-PDU for each receive L-SDU.
  3. By transmitting the lower layer module and receive I-PDU for each receive L-SDU.
  4. By receiving the lower layer module and transmit I-PDU for each transmit L-SDU.

In networking, which of the following CAN protocol nodes can access the request transmission rights:

  1. Classical CAN
  2. CAN FD

In networking, if you are required to follow the PDU architecture for the AUTOSAR communication stack. The Link Protocol Data Unit (LPDU) is used for the transmission request and transmission polling API of the upper layer module. Which of the following LPDU IDs is used by the LPDU that is defined by the CAN Interface as a parameter?
